snippet: The longstanding Confucian tradition of “humane authority” is most likely to drive debates over China’s political future.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Jian Qing, founder of the Yangming Confucian Academy, and editor Daniel A Bell disputes the view, commonplace in the West, that China should become more democratic; predicts that the future of China is far likelier to be determined by the longstanding Confucian tradition of 'humane authority' than by Western-style multiparty elections.

byline.original: By JIANG QING and DANIEL A. BELL

lead_paragraph: The longstanding Confucian tradition of “humane authority” is most likely to drive debates over China’s political future.
